com.jcraft.jsch

Interface Random


  • public interface Random
    A random number generator.

    The library used an object (or in fact, multiple ones in different places) implementing this interface to generate random numbers. These are used for several purposes:

    • to create key pairs
    • To salt the known hosts entries in the hashed format
    • For random padding of a packet before encrypting
    • For the random session cookie

    The library will choose the implementation class by the configuration option random, and instantiate it using the no-argument constructor.

    The library includes a default implementation, based on a new SecureRandom().

    An application might implement this interface to provide an alternative random number generator, maybe based on some hardware device.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fill(byte[] foo, int start, int len)
      Fills a segment of a byte array with random bits.

    • Method Detail

      • fill

        void fill(byte[] foo,
          int start,
          int len)
        Fills a segment of a byte array with random bits.
        Parameters:
        foo - the array to put the random data into.
        start - the position in the array from where on the random data should be put.
        len - the length of the segment to be filled with random data, in bytes. There will be 8 * len random bits generated.
